MANUAL: ps-classification-supplemental (2.4.0)

Contents

  • Introduction.
  • Quick Start
  • Options

Introduction

ps-classification-supplemental performs SNP classification using additional filters that may be required for polyploidy organisms, those with highly repetitive or complex genomes, or for studying inbred populations. ps-classification must have previously been run. It classifies SNPs into sixteen potential categories, the seven original categories from ps-classification and nine new categories: "PolyHighResolution", "nMinorHom", "UnexpectedHeterozygosity", "ABvarianceY", "AAvarianceY", "BBvarianceY", "ABvarianceX", "AAvarianceX", "BBvarianceX", "HomHomResolution", "NoMinorHom", "OTV", "MonoHighResolution", "CallRate-BelowThreshold", "Hemizygous", and "Other".

More details describing the use of ps-classification-supplemental can be found in the SNPolisher User Guide available on Affymetrix.com.

Quick Start

To run ps-classification-supplemental on performance file ./input/Ps.performance.txt, summary file ./input/AxiomGT1.summary.txt, calls file ./input/AxiomGT1.calls.txt and posteriors file ./input/AxiomGT1.snp-posteriors.txt: 

ps-classification-supplemental --performance-file ./input/Ps.performance.txt --summary-file ./input/AxiomGT1.summary.txt --calls-file ./input/AxiomGT1.calls.txt --posteriors-file ./input/AxiomGT1.snp-posteriors.txt --output-dir ./output

Details

ps-classification-supplemental produces multiple files written to the specified output directory. A SNP list is written for each category that has at least one SNP classified into it (e.g. "AAvarianceX.ps”). If a category does not have any SNPs, then it will not have a SNP list. If a name is not supplied for the modified posterior file with unique cluster variance values, the defaul name “AxiomGT1.snp-posterior.uniquevar.txt” is used. If a name is not supplied for the updated peformance file, the default name “Ps.performance.uniquevar.txt” is used.

The user may choose to not use a subset of variance categories by not supplying values for both the .cut and .Z.cut variables, e.g. if there are no values supplied for AA.varX.Z.cut and AA.varX.cut, then the category AAvarianceX will not be used.

Options: 

   'ps-classification-supplemental'
   2.4.0 svn://svn.affymetrix.com/apt2-snppolisher/branches/APT_SP_2_4_0_BRANCH@777(1494) 2015-08-14-10:29


USAGE:
Four required parameters must be specified if batch folder is not used: 
ps-classification-supplemental --performance-file <FILE> --summary-file <FILE>
 --call-file <FILE> --posterior-file <FILE> --output-dir <DIR> [OPTIONS]
OR 
In case of batch folder usage, specify the following: 
ps-classification-supplemental --batch-folder <FILE> --output-dir <DIR> [OPTIONS]

USER HELP ----------

  --version (flag) = Display the version info for this program.

  --user-help (flag) = Display help intended for end-users.
    Aliases: --help, -h

  --log-file (string8) = The name of the log file.  Defaults to 'PROGRAMNAME-NUMBER.log'.
    Aliases: --lf

  --console-add-select (string8) = Add selectors for console messages.
    e.g. to include all debug messages: --console-add-select debug
         to include all messages of level 3 or higher: --console-add-select '*:3'


  --console-add-neg-select (string8) = Add selectors to be excluded from console messages.
    e.g. to exclude all warning messages and errors summary: --console-add-neg-select WARNING,summary


  --arg-file (filename) = Read arguments from this file.
    File should be a valid XML file, and should contain elements of the form
    <Parameter name="PARAMETER-NAME" analysis="NODE-NAME" currentValue="VALUE" />.

  --check-param (flag) = Stop the program after the command parameters have been checked.

  --performance-file (filename) = Full path name of performance file generated by Ps_Classification.
    default value: 'Ps.performance.txt'

  --posterior-file (filename) = Full path name of posterior file.
    default value: 'AxiomGT1.snp-posteriors.txt'

  --summary-file (filename) = Full path name of summary file.
    default value: 'AxiomGT1.summary.txt'

  --call-file (filename) = Full path name of call file.
    default value: 'AxiomGT1.calls.txt'

  --output-dir (dirname,required) = Path to output directory.

  --report-file-ext (string8) = File extension for the ps report files
    default value: 'ps'

  --batch-folder (filename) = Path to the batch folder.
    default value: 'batch.folder'

  --output-posterior-file (string8) = File name of the output posterior file.
    default value: 'AxiomGT1.snp-posteriors.uniquevar.txt'

  --output-performance-file (string8) = File name of the output performance file.
    default value: 'Ps.performance.uniquevar.txt'

  --homfld-cut (float64) = HomFLD.cut
    default value: '6.500000'

  --bb-varx-cut (float64) = BB.varX.cut
    default value: '10.000000'

  --bb-vary-cut (float64) = BB.varY.cut
    default value: '10.000000'

  --ab-varx-cut (float64) = AB.varX.cut
    default value: '10.000000'

  --ab-vary-cut (float64) = AB.varY.cut
    default value: '10.000000'

  --aa-varx-cut (float64) = AA.varX.cut
    default value: '10.000000'

  --aa-vary-cut (float64) = AA.varY.cut
    default value: '10.000000'

  --bb-varx-z-cut (float64) = BB.varX.Z.cut
    default value: '3.000000'

  --bb-vary-z-cut (float64) = BB.varY.Z.cut
    default value: '3.000000'

  --ab-varx-z-cut (float64) = AB.varX.Z.cut
    default value: '3.000000'

  --ab-vary-z-cut (float64) = AB.varY.Z.cut
    default value: '3.000000'

  --aa-varx-z-cut (float64) = AA.varX.Z.cut
    default value: '3.000000'

  --aa-vary-z-cut (float64) = AA.varY.Z.cut
    default value: '3.000000'

  --aa-vary-z-cut-enabled (bool) = AA.varY.Z.cut.enabled
    default value: 'True'

  --ab-vary-z-cut-enabled (bool) = AB.varY.Z.cut.enabled
    default value: 'True'

  --bb-vary-z-cut-enabled (bool) = BB.varY.Z.cut.enabled
    default value: 'True'

  --aa-varx-z-cut-enabled (bool) = AA.varX.Z.cut.enabled
    default value: 'True'

  --ab-varx-z-cut-enabled (bool) = AB.varX.Z.cut.enabled
    default value: 'True'

  --bb-varx-z-cut-enabled (bool) = BB.varX.Z.cut.enabled
    default value: 'True'

  --clustermin (float64) = clustermin
    default value: '5.000000'

  --n-minor-hom-cut (float64) = nMinorHom.cut
    default value: '0.000000'

  --hetv-maf-cut (float64) = HetvMAF.cut
    default value: '10.000000'

  --variance-class (vec_string8) = List of variance.class categories. Allows a single category or a comma separated list
    default value: 'PolyHighResolution'

  --@help       = print developer help
